page.title: 16EASTER ULSTON
page.content: This farm of 325 acres is owned and managed by George Rae,a tall,strappin' fresh-faced single man,well known to local folk as an excellent reciter of Burns' poetry,especially Tam o'Shanter Like other farms in the area,it has cattle and sheep.There are 135 cows,mainly heifers,which will eventually be sold at St.Boswells, or Hawick,Hexham or Longtown.The breeds are{Shorthorns,Charolais,Angus {Friesians and Limousins.There are 156 ewes,mainly{Suffolk ewes. George breeds collies,and his Billy Goat,a wild fellow,is kept busy also. George's crops are mainly for selling.140 acres winter barley,135 spring barley,24 acres wheat and 15 acres oats for feeding his own cattle. Also 2 acres cabbage to feed the tups. He also has 3 dairy cows,6 hens,3dogs 3 guinea fowls,and 2 cockerels.Phew!
